text: it would be better if it works then I'll
be on the bike now yeah it doesn't seem
to work maybe we have to fight another
station it's been a rough road so far
for New York City's ambitious bike share
program we have basically imported
Europe's most boring idea the program
started two weeks ago with the
installation of 6,000 shiny blue bikes
across more than 300 stations in New
York City but on Wednesday a multi bike
trip from Brooklyn into midtown
Manhattan with several stops at stations
along the way revealed some of the
problems that have be devilish and led
to a flurry of complaints about a system
some say was not ready for primetime
it's been my experience 40% 50%
sometimes on bad days don't report that
the bike has been returned or I can't
get a bike out and it's just not taking
my card before I had no problem at all
and I've been using it all around in
Brooklyn and yeah it looks like I'll
have to go turn at the station
just across the Brooklyn Bridge at City
Hall one of the city's bike fixers was
busy resetting the entire rack although
almost every bike was fine someone had
pushed every button signaling the need
for repair and I don't know if it was
malicious
it could have been soon after the
station's first customer arrived
we're from Sweden and we arrived here
last Saturday and we're gonna be here
for a week anything like taking your
bike for a tour is really nice but
things didn't go as hoped yeah it
doesn't seem to work maybe we have to
find another station just up the street
at Hudson and Reed bike share users were
greeted with a blank screen the entire
station it seemed was without power the
bike share iPhone app directed users to
this same station suggesting everything
was just fine of course despite these
problems the system seemed to work fine
for many but it was flawless I loved it
it's been acceptable for me I haven't
had any problems with bad kiosk so those
sorts of things so far others just found
it confusing did it give me the code for
the bike that I'm supposed to get or did
it give me a code that I have to enter
somewhere or do I dip my car so far the
city says that more than 170 thousand
trips have been taken with annual
memberships surpassing 36 thousand I
look at this as a big quality of life
enhancer yet the biggest problem
encountered on this day was at Grand
Central Station one of the system's
largest which was entirely shut down
I've had two trips already where I was
charged 45 hours because I thought had
taken and then someone took it out and
drove it around for two days they
cleared the charge but it's crazy this
is all these stations are down the bike
share program is clearly going through
growing pains and city officials who
would not go on camera said in an
e-mailed statement that this was an
adjustment period
New Yorkers for the most part seem
enthusiastic and well not always the
most patient people in the world seem
willing for now to give the program a
chance I don't want it to think like
a terrible program it's the best thing I
think that's happened to the city and
I've been living here for 30 years this
is Eric Olsen reporting for The New York
Times
